business.headline: Delhi Mahila Samriddhi Scheme: Check if you are eligible for Rs 2,500 monthly aidThe Delhi government will launch an online portal where women can submit their applications. The IT department is also developing special software to verify eligibility.

He recently announced that reciprocal tariffs would kick in on April 2 and made it clear that India wouldn't be getting any special treatment.

Starting Tuesday, his administration will slap a 25% tariff on goods from Canada and Mexico. The US President is also hiking tariffs on Chinese imports, raising the rate from 10% to 20%.

Reliance Industries says oil ministry raised $2.81 billion demand in gas dispute caseOn February 14, a division bench at Delhi High Court ruled against Reliance and its partners in a dispute regarding extraction of gas in a deepwater field in India's KG D6 block in the Krishna Godavari basin in the country's eastern coast.

Actor Sumbul Touqeer blasts trolls for body-shaming: Never been more madTelevision actor Sumbul Touqeer Khan has addressed the body-shaming and trolling she faced in a recent social media post. She clarified that her weight gain was due to medication and urged trolls to stop their unwarranted comments.

With Love, Meghan first reviews: Meghan Markle's show called queasy, unlovableIn 'With Love, Meghan', Meghan Markle arranges flowers, cooks delectable exquisite food with her celebrity friends, and gives stunning glimpses of her gorgeous Montecito house with a sprawling ocean view.

BRIT Awards 2025: Charli XCX wins album of the year, full winners list hereCharli XCX emerged as a major winner at the Brit Awards 2025, securing multiple accolades. Artists including Sabrina Carpenter and Billie Eilish also took home some of the biggest awards of the night.

Honey Singh returns to Delhi for sold-out Millionaire concert: What to expectYo Yo Honey Singh's Millionaire India Tour hits Delhi with a sold-out show, 20,000 fans, top celebs, and a surprise setlist. His parents will attend the concert, making this emotional homecoming extra special.

Ranya Rao's 30 UAE visits, Rs 12 lakh per trip for smuggling gold: 5 findingsRanya Rao case: The Kannada actor, who was arrested with gold bars worth Rs 12.56 crore from the Bengaluru airport, has travelled to Dubai 30 times over the past year.

Supreme Court bars new cases against Udhayanidhi Stalin on Sanatan Dharma remarksThe Supreme Court has ruled that no fresh cases can be filed against Tamil Nadu Deputy Chief Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin over his Sanatan Dharma remarks unless permitted by the court, offering legal relief.

Amid language row, RSS leader says knowing Marathi not a must to live in MumbaiRSS leader Bhaiyyaji Joshi's remarks come at a time when the BJP-led Maharashtra government has made Marathi compulsory in primary and secondary schools to promote the local language.

South Korea fighter jet accidentally drops bombs on homes, 15 civilians injuredAt least 15 people were injured after a fighter jet from South Korea's Air Force dropped eight bombs in the wrong place during a training exercise. The incident, which occurred on Tuesday, damaged houses and a church in South Korea's Pocheon.

US man swallows Tiffany & Co. diamond earrings worth Rs 6 crore after robberyThe man fled the store with two pairs of earrings - one featuring 4.86 carats and priced at $160,000 (Rs 1.3 crore approximately), while the other, an 8.10-carat set, was valued at $609,500 (Rs 5.3 crore approximately).

Minor Dalit girl gang-raped in UP, family claims 'Om' tattoo burnt with acidAs per the complaint filed by the survivor's family, she was abducted on January 2 while she was on her way to a tailor. She was then taken to an undisclosed location where she was repeatedly assaulted.

Release hostages now or you're dead: Trump after US holds talks with HamasAs the US held unprecedented talks with Hamas on Gaza hostages, President Donald Trump gave a stern "last warning" to the Palestinian terror group to release the remaining captives or "there will be hell to pay later".

Myanmar rebel groups sign merger pact in Mizoram, in CM's presence: ReportsTwo Myanmar-based pro-democracy rebel groups, Chinland Council and the Interim Chin National Consultative Council (ICNCC), have signed a merger agreement in the presence of Mizoram CM Lalduhoma. The unification of the rebels in Lalduhoma's presence, who has called it his "mission", is expected to bolster their resistance against Myanmar's junta.

Alia Bhatt on ADHD diagnosis: My body starts heating up in social gatheringsActor Alia Bhatt has opened up about her ADHD and anxiety diagnosis. In a recent interview with Jay Shetty, she spoke about how her body reacts in social gatherings and clarified that she is not on medication.

27-year-old Telangana student shot dead in US, father recalls last callA 27-year-old man from Telangana was shot dead at a store in the US where he used to work part-time after robbers opened fire. The victim's father said he received the news of his death from his friends.

Bizarre theft in Bengaluru: Gang steals Rs 1 crore worth of hair, police hunt onThieves stole hair worth Rs 90 lakh to Rs 1 crore from a Bengaluru godown in Lakshmipur Cross. The gang of six, caught on CCTV, targeted the stock meant for export to China, Burma, and Hong Kong. Police have launched an investigation after godown owner Venkataramana filed a complaint.

MK Stalin hits out at 'Hindi zealots', says Hindi naming of laws is chauvinism Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin slammed critics calling the DMK chauvinists, asserting that demanding linguistic equality is a right, not an offence. He criticised the renaming of criminal laws in Hindi and called NEP "poison" imposed on non-Hindi states.

Kedarnath ropeway approved: Travel time cut from 9 hours to 36 minutesThe government has approved the ₹4,081 crore Kedarnath ropeway project, which will cut travel time from 9 hours to only 36 minutes.

Compact SUV space has a new king. It is not Skoda Kylaq, Kia Syros, Mahindra XUV 3XOThis is the fastest car in India to reach the sales milestone of 1,00,000 units and 2,00,000 units.

Woman can't claim rape after being in live-in for 16 years: Supreme CourtThe Supreme Court, while cancelling the rape case against the man, ruled that a mere breach of marriage promise doesn't amount to rape unless it's proven that the accused never intended to marry at the onset of the relationship.

Russo brothers say Robert Downey Jr is 'writing backstory' for Doctor DoomFilmmakers Joe and Anthony Russo recently claimed that actor Robert Downey Jr is heavily invested in making Doctor Doom. The film will mark the star's return to the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Alia Bhatt says Jigra's failure gave her a new vigourActor Alia Bhatt addressed the box office failure and underwhelming performance of her recent film Jigra. In an interview, she shared that setbacks motivate and energise her.

Shah Rukh Khan's King to go on floors in June: ReportSuperstar Shah Rukh Khan's highly-anticipated King has been delayed by a few months, as per reports. The Siddharth Anand directorial was earlier expected to begin shooting in March.

Rachin special knocks South Africa out, sets up India vs New Zealand finalNew Zealand beat South Africa in the second semi final of the Champions Trophy to qualify for the summit clash against India. Rachin Ravindra and Kane Williamson were heroes for the Kiwis in their clinical show in Lahore.

India, New Zealand to battle in Champions Trophy final after 25 years Champions Trophy 2025: New Zealand produced an all-round effort to outclass South Africa in the second semi-final in Lahore. New Zealand and India will meet in the final of an ICC white-ball tournament for the first time since 2000.

Pakistan journalist's question on 'Dubai advantage' irks Rajeev ShuklaBCCI vice president was seen getting irritated by a question from a Pakistan journalist about India's advantage while playing in Dubai in the ICC Champions Trophhy 2025.

Coldplay at World Cup 2026? FIFA president confirms half-time show in finalFIFA president Gianni Infantino has confirmed that the football World Cup 2026 will have a first of its kind halftime show in the final of the tournament. The FIFA World Cup will be jointly hosted by United States, Canada, and Mexico.

Rajeev Shukla watches Champions Trophy semi-final with PCB Chief Mohsin NaqviBCCI vice President Rajeev Shukla was spotted watching the second semi-final of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 with PCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi in Lahore.

I just love batting: Kohli speaks from the heart in Champions Trophy interviewSenior India batter Virat Kohli gave a raw interview after India pulled off a nervy chase against Australia in the semi-final of the Champions Trophy 2025. Kohli said that as long as the joy of batting was there, other things just took care of themselves.

Watch: KL Rahul's kind gesture towards pitch-invading fan wins hearts Star India batter KL Rahul's gesture towards a pitch-invading fan after the semi final of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 against Australia is being loved by the fans worldwide.

SA vs NZ: Kane Williamson surpasses AB de Villiers after 15th ODI hundredNew Zealand batter Kane Williamson scored a magnificent century in the second semi-final of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 against South Africa. He played a brilliant knock of 102 (94) smashing ten fours and two sixes.

NZ vs SA: Olympic champion Arshad Nadeem brings out Champions Trophy before matchPakistan's Olympic champion Arshad Nadeem was the special guest as he brought out the Champions Trophy ahead of the semi-final between New Zealand and South Africa on Wednesday, March 5.

Rachin Ravindra emulates Sourav Ganguly with twin hundreds in Champions Tropy 2025Champions Trophy, SA vs NZ: Rachin Ravindra became the eighth batter and the first New Zealander to hit more than one hundred in an edition of the Champions Trophy. The 24-year-old hit his fifth hundred in ICC ODI tournaments.

Champions Trophy: Kane Williamson becomes 4th fastest to 19000 international runsKane Williamson completed 19000 runs in international cricket during the second semi-final of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 against South Africa and became the fourth fastest to reach the milestone.

Steve Smith retires from ODIs: Your impact beyond numbers, says Yuvraj SinghWorld Cup-winning all-rounder Yuvraj Singh reminisced about his IPL stint with Steve Smith as he wished the Australian batter the best for the future. Smith retired from ODIs on Wednesday

KKR's clash with LSG on April 6 faces hurdle over security arrangementsDefending champions Kolkata Knight Riders' clash against Lucknow Super Giants on April 6 faces a major roadblock as Kolkata Police has expressed its inability to provide adequate security for the match due to Ram Navami celebrations.

Table tennis great Sharath Kamal announces retirement after two-decade-long career Five-time Olympian Sharath Kamal announced he will bring the curtains down on his decorated career after playing a tournament in Chennai in March.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.
